name: Creamy Persimmon Sorbet
description: A plush, creamy sorbet full of honeyed sweetness that's cut by a touch of malty astringency.
recipeIngredient: 4 to 5 large persimmons (about 20 ounces; see note), peeled and chopped
1/2 cup very strong black tea, or water
1 teaspoon fresh juice from 1 lemon (more or less to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine persimmons with sugar in blender or food processor and process on high speed until very smooth, about 30 seconds. Pour through a strainer to measure out 2 cups of purée, reserving remainder for another use.
Transfer purée to a medium-sized mixing bowl and whisk in tea, lemon juice, and salt to taste. Chill in freezer until mixture is very cold, 2 to 3 hours.
Churn in ice cream maker according to manufacturer's instructions. Serve immediately as soft serve or transfer to an airtight container and chill in freezer for 4 hours for a firmer texture.
